Rotate a 2D plot by specified number of degrees — ggrotate_xy
text: df Original dataframe object x Name column containing data plotted x-axis y Name column containing data plotted x-axis deg Degrees rotate plotted data

title: Rotate a 2D plot by specified number of degrees — ggrotate_xy
text: dataframe x y coordinates rotated specified number degrees

title: Rotate a 2D plot by specified number of degrees — ggrotate_xy
text: Mostly using rotate plots Slide-seq spatial transcriptomics data figure prep.

title: Rotate a 2D plot by specified number of degrees — ggrotate_xy
code: library(jmvtools) jmvtools:::spatial_data |>     ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x, y, color=factor(cluster))) +     ggplot2::geom_point() +     ggplot2::theme_void() +     ggsci::scale_color_igv()   jmvtools:::spatial_data |>     ggrotate_xy(x, y, deg=90) |>     ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x, y, color=factor(cluster))) +     ggplot2::geom_point() +     ggplot2::theme_void() +     ggsci::scale_color_igv()

title: SuperPlots — jmv_superplots
code: jmv_superplots(df, groups, replicate, value, font_size = 20, ylab = "")

title: SuperPlots — jmv_superplots
text: df data frame containing data plotted groups name data frame column containing group levels information replicate name data frame column containing replicate levels information value name data frame column containing values plotted y-axis group, replicate font_size font size parameter passed cowplot::theme_cowplot() function ylab Label y-axis plot

title: SuperPlots — jmv_superplots
text: ggplot object

title: SuperPlots — jmv_superplots
code: df_1 <- data.frame(value = sample(100:200, 100, replace=TRUE),                   group = rep(1:4, 25),                   replicate = 1) df_2 <- data.frame(value = sample(100:200, 100, replace=TRUE),                    group = rep(1:4, 25),                    replicate = 2)  df_3 <- data.frame(value = sample(100:200, 100, replace=TRUE),                    group = rep(1:4, 25),                    replicate = 3)  df <- do.call(rbind, list(df_1, df_2, df_3)) jmv_superplots(df, groups = group, replicate = replicate, value = value)
